page.title: 11AMENITIES IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: THE SHOP Mr & Mrs Meggison have kept the local P.O. & shop fpr 22 years.The shop is a general store and also supplies newspapers,bread and milk daily. Regular orders are placed from Sutton Hall & passing tourists buy ice-cream & sweets. THE WHITESTONECLIFFE PUB -The present owners have been landlords for 2 years. The non-residential pub caters for local drinking, passing tourists and the flat owners from Sutton Hall. Bar meals are served at lunchtime and in the evening and cost up to Â£5, evening dinners are served in the restaurant, these cost up to Â£10. SUTTON BANK GARAGE-Mr Robert Gray has owned the garage for 6 years. He employs 1 mechanic. He relies heavily on passing trade for petrol sales. In 1985 petrol costs about Â£1.97 per gallon.
